thread.title: Tottenham star Dele Alli sets up property company as midfielder plans for life after football
thread.title_full: Tottenham star Dele Alli sets up property company as midfielder plans for life after football

author: Jacob Murtagh
title: Tottenham star Dele Alli sets up property company as midfielder plans for life after football
text:
Sport Tottenham star Dele Alli sets up property company as midfielder plans for life after football Alli set up Future Homes Investments Ltd last November and is reportedly eyeing up houses in the south Share It is a shrewd move by Spurs star Dele Alli (Photo: Reuters) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Tottenham star Dele Alli is planning for life after football by setting up his own property company. 
The England ace launched Future Homes Investments Ltd last November and is reportedly eyeing up houses in the south in a bid to add them to his new empire. 
Alli splashed out £2.25million on a Hertfordshire mansion, which he shares with childhood pal Harry Hickford. 
The house boasts a gym, cinema room, wine cellar and underground garage. 
And it is understood Alli is on the lookout for more properties, with Alan Hickford, the man he credits with bringing him up, acting as a consultant. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Dele Alli gets trolled on live TV Share this video Watch Next 
A source told The Sun : “Dele is being clever and wants to make sure that he has a series of investments which will continue to grow well beyond his football career. 
“He should have many, many more years at the top but you never know what is around the corner and even though he is a wealthy young man, investing in property is never a bad move.” 
Alli burst onto the big stage last season following his £5m switch from MK Dons. Dele Alli of Tottenham Hotspur poses with manager Mauricio Pochettino while signing a new contract (Photo: Getty Images) 
The 20-year-old was rewarded with a bumper new contract in September, which ties him to White Hart Lane until 2022. 
His exploits have caught the eye of European giants Real Madrid, but Alli has shown he's already looking to the future. poll loading Is Dele Alli the best English player in the Premier League? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
